00017 package WeBWorK::File::Scoring;
00018 use base qw/Exporter/;
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::File::Scoring - parse scoring files.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 use IO::File;
00029 
00030 our $MIN_FIELDS = 6; # there are six "info" fields. we need at least those
00031 #our $MAX_FIELDS; # no maximum in scoring files
00032 
00033 our $KEY_INDEX = 0; # index of field to use for record key in resulting hash
00034 
00035 our @EXPORT = qw/parse_scoring_file/;
00036 
00037 sub parse_scoring_file($) {
00038     my ($file) = @_;
00039     
00040     my $fh = new IO::File($file, "<")
00041         or die "Failed to open scoring file '$file' for reading: $!\n";
00042     
00043     my %records;
00044     
00045     while (<$fh>) {
00046         chomp;
00047         next if /^#/;
00048         next unless /\S/;
00049         s/^\s*//;
00050         s/\s*$//;
00051         
00052         my @fields = split /\s*,\s*/, $_, -1; # -1 == don't delete empty trailing fields
00053         my $fields = @fields;
00054         if ($fields < $MIN_FIELDS) {
00055             warn "Skipped invalid line $. of scoring files '$file': expected at least $MIN_FIELDS fields, got $fields fields.\n";
00056             next;
00057         }
00058         
00059         $records{$fields[$KEY_INDEX]} = \@fields;
00060     }
00061     
00062     $fh->close;
00063     
00064     return \%records;
00065 }
00066 
00067 1;
